definition: Zhang Xu (probably early 8th century), Tang dynasty poet and calligrapher, most famous for his grass script 草書|草书
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
dawn/rising sun

sentences.english: Zhang Xuping confessed to his crime and now faces trial at the intermediate people's court in Luliang.
sentences.chinese: 張旭平認了罪，現將面臨陸梁中級人民法院的審判。

sentences.english: Zhang, Xu like science, welcome to my website.
sentences.chinese: 張旭，喜愛自然科學，歡迎您光臨我的個人網站。

sentences.english: I'm Zhang, Xu, a science amateur, welcome to my website.
sentences.chinese: 我是張旭，自然科學愛好者，歡迎光臨我的個人網站。

sentences.english: Four Notes of Ancient Poetry is the best-known works of Zhang among his many productions coming down to now.
sentences.chinese: 張旭的傳世作品有許多，以《古詩四貼》最著名。

definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
grass script/cursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
feature
great calligraphy master/the Sage of Calligraphy, traditional reference to Wang Xizhi 王羲之[Wang2 Xi1 zhi1] (303-361)
letter/also written 書札|书札
almanac
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
